title: Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved, but they do not have any effect. If a small image, such as an icon, is opened, the scrollbars are misleading because they do not perform any action.
EB: In the ImageAnalyzer example, the scrollbars should be disabled when opening a small image, such as an icon. This will prevent them from being misleading to users.
SR:
1. Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only)
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon.
5. Verify that the scrollbars are disabled and do not respond to movement.
